DGACM.relevance_comment: Directs the Secretary-General to prepare a comprehensive report on the High‑level Political Signing Conference in Palermo. The Department for General Assembly and Conference Management (DGACM) provides conference servicing, documentation and publishing support for high‑level meetings (see PPB: provision of secretariat, documentation and publishing services), so DGACM would be the operational unit likely tasked by the Secretary‑General to produce or support preparation, processing and issuance of that report.

States that the Secretary‑General shall convene the Conference of the Parties not later than one year after entry into force. DGACM’s mandate includes planning, managing and servicing intergovernmental conferences and meetings (PPB: provision of procedural and technical secretariat support and conference‑servicing across duty stations), so DGACM would be responsible for implementing the convening logistics and related secretariat functions.

Provides that the Secretary‑General shall provide the necessary secretariat services to the Conference of the Parties. This is a direct instruction to ensure secretariat support; DGACM’s PPB explicitly assigns it responsibility for substantive and technical secretariat support and high‑quality conference‑servicing (see PPB 2.1(a),(c) and the subprogrammes on planning/coordination, documentation and meetings/publishing), meaning DGACM would implement this obligation.

(Article 33(a)) Requires the secretariat to assist the Conference of the Parties in carrying out the activities in article 32 and to make arrangements and provide necessary services for sessions. This maps to DGACM’s operational responsibilities for arranging meetings and providing conference services (PPB: planning/coordination of conference services, meetings and publishing services, and provision of substantive/technical secretariat support), indicating DGACM would carry out these tasks.

(Article 33(b)) Requires the secretariat, upon request, to assist States Parties in providing information to the Conference of the Parties. DGACM’s PPB includes documentation, publishing and substantive secretariat support (subprogramme 3 and subprogramme 1 activities on procedural/advisory support and documentation services), so DGACM would be the unit to assist with collecting, preparing and managing such information for States and the Conference.

(Article 33(c)) Obligates the secretariat to ensure necessary coordination with the secretariats of relevant international and regional organizations. DGACM’s PPB describes inter‑agency coordination and that the Department will chair and coordinate meetings on language arrangements, documentation and publications (PPB 2.10 and related), so DGACM would implement the required coordination role.
